definition: to insert/stick in/pierce/to take part in/to interfere/to interpose

sentences.english: While a pair of hollow jacks without electrodes are correspondingly and additionally arranged on the lamp base.
sentences.chinese: 而在管座上对应地增设了一对不带电极的空心插孔。

sentences.english: Did you plug them into the line-in jack by mistake?
sentences.chinese: 未插入它们中的行的插孔误？

sentences.english: The usual prongs and holes are mostly hidden.
sentences.chinese: 我们平时使用的插片和插孔大部分都被隐藏起来。

sentences.english: You're going to need the Stereo RCA cable with mini-jack for this step.
sentences.chinese: 你要去需要立体声的RCA电缆与迷你插孔为这一步。

sentences.english: After CNC milling the openings for the variable resistors and the jacks I assembled the components.
sentences.chinese: 在数控铣床的开口的可变电阻和插孔我组装的部件。

definition: bolt (for locking a window, cabinet etc)/(electrical) plug
cigarette lighter (in a car)/12-volt cigarette lighter receptacle
electric light socket/burner (component of a kerosene lamp)/light (as a countable item, e.g. number of lights fitted in a house)
